<a name="2313146"></a>
<div id="answer-2313146" class="answer" data-answerid="2313146"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="2313146">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="9">9</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>In it's simplest form:</p>

<pre><code>function crawl_page($url, $depth = 5) {
    if($depth &gt; 0) {
        $html = file_get_contents($url);

        preg_match_all('~&lt;a.*?href="(.*?)".*?&gt;~', $html, $matches);

        foreach($matches[1] as $newurl) {
            crawl_page($newurl, $depth - 1);
        }

        file_put_contents('results.txt', $newurl."\n\n".$html."\n\n", FILE_APPEND);
    }
}

crawl_page('http://www.domain.com/index.php', 5);
</code></pre>

<p>That function will get contents from a page, then crawl all found links and save the contents to 'results.txt'. The functions accepts an second parameter, depth, which defines how long the links should be followed. Pass 1 there if you want to parse only links from the given page.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2010-02-22T18:29:07"></time>
    <div class="grid--cell mr16" style="flex: 1 1 100px;">

<a name="12193232"></a>
<div id="answer-12193232" class="answer" data-answerid="12193232"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="12193232">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="5">5</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>With some little changes to <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/users/105662/hobodave">hobodave's</a> code, here is a codesnippet you can use to crawl pages. This needs the curl extension to be enabled in your server.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?php
//set_time_limit (0);
function crawl_page($url, $depth = 5){
$seen = array();
if(($depth == 0) or (in_array($url, $seen))){
    return;
}   
$ch = curl_init();
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER,1);
$result = curl_exec ($ch);
curl_close ($ch);
if( $result ){
    $stripped_file = strip_tags($result, "&lt;a&gt;");
    preg_match_all("/&lt;a[\s]+[^&gt;]*?href[\s]?=[\s\"\']+"."(.*?)[\"\']+.*?&gt;"."([^&lt;]+|.*?)?&lt;\/a&gt;/", $stripped_file, $matches, PREG_SET_ORDER ); 
    foreach($matches as $match){
        $href = $match[1];
            if (0 !== strpos($href, 'http')) {
                $path = '/' . ltrim($href, '/');
                if (extension_loaded('http')) {
                    $href = http_build_url($href , array('path' =&gt; $path));
                } else {
                    $parts = parse_url($href);
                    $href = $parts['scheme'] . '://';
                    if (isset($parts['user']) &amp;&amp; isset($parts['pass'])) {
                        $href .= $parts['user'] . ':' . $parts['pass'] . '@';
                    }
                    $href .= $parts['host'];
                    if (isset($parts['port'])) {
                        $href .= ':' . $parts['port'];
                    }
                    $href .= $path;
                }
            }
            crawl_page($href, $depth - 1);
        }
}   
echo "Crawled {$href}";
}   
crawl_page("http://www.sitename.com/",3);
?&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>I have explained this tutorial in this <a href="http://www.webgalli.com/blog/?p=1253" rel="nofollow noreferrer">crawler script tutorial</a></p>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2012-08-30T08:53:19"></time>

<a name="2313172"></a>
<div id="answer-2313172" class="answer" data-answerid="2313172"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="2313172">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="4">4</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>Why use PHP for this, when you can use <a href="http://www.rootr.net/man/info/wget" rel="nofollow noreferrer">wget</a>, e.g.</p>

<pre><code>wget -r -l 1 http://www.example.com
</code></pre>

<p>For how to parse the contents, see <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3577641/best-methods-to-parse-html/3577662#3577662">Best Methods to parse HTML</a> and use the search function for <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3820666/grabbing-the-href-attribute-of-an-a-element/3820783#3820783">examples</a>. How to parse HTML has been answered multiple times before.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2010-02-22T18:33:07"></time>
    <div class="grid--cell mr16" style="flex: 1 1 100px;">

    <li id="comment-6764770" class="comment js-comment " data-comment-id="6764770">
        <div class="js-comment-actions comment-actions">
            <div class="comment-score">
                    <span title="number of &#39;useful comment&#39; votes received"
                            class="cool">1</span>
            </div>
                    </div>
        <div class="comment-text js-comment-text-and-form">
            <div class="comment-body" style="display: block;" >
                
                <span class="comment-copy">@Tomalak You might indeed be missing something obvious here. Yes, I did not answer how to crawl a page <i>with PHP</i>. If you look at my answer, you&#39;ll see I actually state that as the first thing. I gave an alternative which I deem more practical, which is something I&#39;d expect someone that claims to <i>strike a balance between &quot;answering the actual question&quot; and &quot;giving the OP the solution that he actually needs&quot;</i> to understand. I also gave two links to information on how to parse HTML for data. If that&#39;s not good enough for you, keep your dv and/or flag it. I dont care.</span>
                
                    &ndash;&nbsp;<a href="/users/208809/gordon"
                       title="264,211 reputation"
                       class="comment-user">Gordon</a>
                <span class="comment-date" dir="ltr"><span title="2011-05-04 10:15:24Z" class="relativetime-clean">May 4 '11 at 10:15</span></span>
                        <span title="this comment was edited 1 time">
                            <svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon va-text-bottom o50 iconPencilSm" width="14" height="14" viewBox="0 0 14 14"><path d="M8.37 3.7L2 10.11V12h1.88l6.37-6.43zM12.23 2.83L11.1 1.71a.5.5 0 0 0-.7 0L9.2 2.86l1.88 1.84 1.14-1.16a.5.5 0 0 0 0-.71z"/></svg>
                        </span>
                                                            </div>
        </div>
    </li>
            </ul>

<a name="5877026"></a>
<div id="answer-5877026" class="answer" data-answerid="5877026"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="5877026">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="3">3</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>Hobodave you were very close. The only thing I have changed is within the if statement that checks to see if the href attribute of the found anchor tag begins with 'http'. Instead of simply adding the $url variable which would contain the page that was passed in you must first strip it down to the host which can be done using the parse_url php function.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?php
function crawl_page($url, $depth = 5)
{
  static $seen = array();
  if (isset($seen[$url]) || $depth === 0) {
    return;
  }

  $seen[$url] = true;

  $dom = new DOMDocument('1.0');
  @$dom-&gt;loadHTMLFile($url);

  $anchors = $dom-&gt;getElementsByTagName('a');
  foreach ($anchors as $element) {
    $href = $element-&gt;getAttribute('href');
    if (0 !== strpos($href, 'http')) {
       /* this is where I changed hobodave's code */
        $host = "http://".parse_url($url,PHP_URL_HOST);
        $href = $host. '/' . ltrim($href, '/');
    }
    crawl_page($href, $depth - 1);
  }

  echo "New Page:&lt;br /&gt; ";
  echo "URL:",$url,PHP_EOL,"&lt;br /&gt;","CONTENT:",PHP_EOL,$dom-&gt;saveHTML(),PHP_EOL,PHP_EOL,"  &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;";
}

crawl_page("http://hobodave.com/", 5);
?&gt;
</code></pre>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2011-05-03T23:50:47"></time>
    <div class="grid--cell mr16" style="flex: 1 1 100px;">

<div id="answer-2313212" class="answer" data-answerid="2313212"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="2313212">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>As mentioned, there are crawler frameworks all ready for customizing out there, but if what you're doing is as simple as you mentioned, you could make it from scratch pretty easily.</p>

<p>Scraping the links: <a href="http://www.phpro.org/examples/Get-Links-With-DOM.html" rel="nofollow noreferrer">http://www.phpro.org/examples/Get-Links-With-DOM.html</a></p>

<p>Dumping results to a file: <a href="http://www.tizag.com/phpT/filewrite.php" rel="nofollow noreferrer">http://www.tizag.com/phpT/filewrite.php</a></p>
    </div>

<p>The question is how to get ajax calls source code? this is not crawled, for example how to crawl the pictures on a link like this? <a href="http://www.tiendeo.nl/Catalogi/amsterdam/16558&amp;subori=web_sliders&amp;buscar=Boni&amp;sw=1366" rel="nofollow">http://www.tiendeo.nl/Catalogi/amsterdam/16558&amp;subori=web_sliders&amp;buscar=Boni&amp;sw=1366</a></p>

<a name="32604778"></a>
<div id="answer-32604778" class="answer" data-answerid="32604778"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="32604778">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="1">1</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>I used @hobodave's code, with this little tweak to prevent re-crawling all fragment variants of the same URL:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?php
function crawl_page($url, $depth = 5)
{
  $parts = parse_url($url);
  if(array_key_exists('fragment', $parts)){
    unset($parts['fragment']);
    $url = http_build_url($parts);
  }

  static $seen = array();
  ...
</code></pre>

<p>Then you can also omit the <code>$parts = parse_url($url);</code> line within the for loop.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2015-09-16T09:32:37"></time>

<div class="user-info ">
    <div class="user-action-time">
        answered <span title="2015-09-16 09:32:37Z" class="relativetime">Sep 16 '15 at 9:32</span>
    </div>
    <div class="user-gravatar32">
        <a href="/users/1091231/pasqal"><div class="gravatar-wrapper-32"><img src="https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/dafd383ed45590143cd7cdb668537df3?s=32&amp;d=identicon&amp;r=PG&amp;f=1" alt="" width="32" height="32"></div></a>
    </div>
    <div class="user-details" itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
        <a href="/users/1091231/pasqal">pasqal</a><span class="d-none" itemprop="name">pasqal</span>
        <div class="-flair">
            <span class="reputation-score" title="reputation score " dir="ltr">11</span><span title="4 bronze badges"><span class="badge3"></span><span class="badgecount">4</span></span>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

    </div>
    </div>

<a name="35146732"></a>
<div id="answer-35146732" class="answer" data-answerid="35146732"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="35146732">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="1">1</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>You can try this it may be help to you</p>

<pre><code>$search_string = 'american golf News: Fowler beats stellar field in Abu Dhabi';
$html = file_get_contents(url of the site);
$dom = new DOMDocument;
$titalDom = new DOMDocument;
$tmpTitalDom = new DOMDocument;
libxml_use_internal_errors(true);
@$dom-&gt;loadHTML($html);
libxml_use_internal_errors(false);
$xpath = new DOMXPath($dom);
$videos = $xpath-&gt;query('//div[@class="primary-content"]');
foreach ($videos as $key =&gt; $video) {
$newdomaindom = new DOMDocument;    
$newnode = $newdomaindom-&gt;importNode($video, true);
$newdomaindom-&gt;appendChild($newnode);
@$titalDom-&gt;loadHTML($newdomaindom-&gt;saveHTML());
$xpath1 = new DOMXPath($titalDom);
$titles = $xpath1-&gt;query('//div[@class="listingcontainer"]/div[@class="list"]');
if(strcmp(preg_replace('!\s+!',' ',  $titles-&gt;item(0)-&gt;nodeValue),$search_string)){     
    $tmpNode = $tmpTitalDom-&gt;importNode($video, true);
    $tmpTitalDom-&gt;appendChild($tmpNode);
    break;
}
}
echo $tmpTitalDom-&gt;saveHTML();
</code></pre>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">

<a name="48954382"></a>
<div id="answer-48954382" class="answer" data-answerid="48954382"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="48954382">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="1">1</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>Thank you @hobodave.</p>

<p>However I found two weaknesses in your code.
Your parsing of the original url to get the "host" segment stops at the first single slash. This presumes that all relative links start in the root directory. This only true sometimes.</p>

<pre><code>original url   :  http://example.com/game/index.html
href in &lt;a&gt; tag:  highscore.html
author's intent:  http://example.com/game/highscore.html  &lt;-200-&gt;
crawler result :  http://example.com/highscore.html       &lt;-404-&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>fix this by breaking at the last single slash not the first</p>

<p>a second unrelated bug, is that <code>$depth</code> does not really track recursion depth, it tracks <em>breadth</em> of the first level of recursion. </p>

<p>If I believed this page were in active use I might debug this second issue, but I suspect the text I am writing now will never be read by anyone, human or robot, since this issue is six years old and I do not even have enough reputation to notify +hobodave directly about these defects by commmenting on his code. Thanks anyway hobodave.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2018-02-23T18:47:07"></time>

<a name="48223234"></a>
<div id="answer-48223234" class="answer" data-answerid="48223234"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="48223234">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="0">0</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>I came up with the following spider code.
I adapted it a bit from the following:
<a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11278010/php-is-the-there-a-safe-way-to-perform-deep-recursion">PHP - Is the there a safe way to perform deep recursion?</a>
it seems fairly rapid....</p>

<pre><code>    &lt;?php
function  spider( $base_url , $search_urls=array() ) {
    $queue[] = $base_url;
    $done           =   array();
    $found_urls     =   array();
    while($queue) {
            $link = array_shift($queue);
            if(!is_array($link)) {
                $done[] = $link;
                foreach( $search_urls as $s) { if (strstr( $link , $s )) { $found_urls[] = $link; } }
                if( empty($search_urls)) { $found_urls[] = $link; }
                if(!empty($link )) {
echo 'LINK:::'.$link;
                      $content =    file_get_contents( $link );
//echo 'P:::'.$content;
                    preg_match_all('~&lt;a.*?href="(.*?)".*?&gt;~', $content, $sublink);
                    if (!in_array($sublink , $done) &amp;&amp; !in_array($sublink , $queue)  ) {
                           $queue[] = $sublink;
                    }
                }
            } else {
                    $result=array();
                    $return = array();
                    // flatten multi dimensional array of URLs to one dimensional.
                    while(count($link)) {
                         $value = array_shift($link);
                         if(is_array($value))
                             foreach($value as $sub)
                                $link[] = $sub;
                         else
                               $return[] = $value;
                     }
                     // now loop over one dimensional array.
                     foreach($return as $link) {
                                // echo 'L::'.$link;
                                // url may be in form &lt;a href.. so extract what's in the href bit.
                                preg_match_all('/&lt;a[^&gt;]+href=([\'"])(?&lt;href&gt;.+?)\1[^&gt;]*&gt;/i', $link, $result);
                                if ( isset( $result['href'][0] )) { $link = $result['href'][0]; }
                                // add the new URL to the queue.
                                if( (!strstr( $link , "http")) &amp;&amp; (!in_array($base_url.$link , $done)) &amp;&amp; (!in_array($base_url.$link , $queue)) ) {
                                     $queue[]=$base_url.$link;
                                } else {
                                    if ( (strstr( $link , $base_url  ))  &amp;&amp; (!in_array($base_url.$link , $done)) &amp;&amp; (!in_array($base_url.$link , $queue)) ) {
                                         $queue[] = $link;
                                    }
                                }
                      }
            }
    }


    return $found_urls;
}    


    $base_url       =   'https://www.houseofcheese.co.uk/';
    $search_urls    =   array(  $base_url.'acatalog/' );
    $done = spider( $base_url  , $search_urls  );

    //
    // RESULT
    //
    //
    echo '&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;';
    echo 'RESULT:::';
    foreach(  $done as $r )  {
        echo 'URL:::'.$r.'&lt;br /&gt;';
    }
</code></pre>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2018-01-12T09:32:35"></time>

<a name="48620540"></a>
<div id="answer-48620540" class="answer" data-answerid="48620540"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="48620540">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="0">0</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>Its worth remembering that when crawling external links (I do appreciate the OP relates to a users own page) you should be aware of robots.txt. I have found the following which will hopefully help <a href="http://www.the-art-of-web.com/php/parse-robots/" rel="nofollow noreferrer">http://www.the-art-of-web.com/php/parse-robots/</a>.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2018-02-05T10:32:44"></time>
    <div class="grid--cell mr16" style="flex: 1 1 100px;">

                    data-addlink-disabled="true">

            </ul>
	    </div>

        <div id="comments-link-48620540" data-rep=50 data-anon=true>

                <a class="js-add-link comments-link disabled-link "
                   title="Use comments to ask for more information or suggest improvements. Avoid comments like “+1” or “thanks”."
                   >add a comment</a><span class="js-link-separator dno">&nbsp;|&nbsp;</span>
            <a class="js-show-link comments-link dno" title="expand to show all comments on this post" href=# onclick=""></a>
        </div>         
    </div>    </div>
</div>

  
<a name="48621099"></a>
<div id="answer-48621099" class="answer" data-answerid="48621099"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="48621099">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="0">0</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>I created a small class to grab data from the provided url, then extract html elements of your choice. The class makes use of CURL and DOMDocument.</p>

<p><strong>php class:</strong></p>

<pre><code>class crawler {


   public static $timeout = 2;
   public static $agent   = 'Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; Googlebot/2.1; +http://www.google.com/bot.html)';


   public static function http_request($url) {
      $ch = curl_init();
      curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL,            $url);
      curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT,      self::$agent);
      curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, self::$timeout);
      curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT,        self::$timeout);
      curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
      $response = curl_exec($ch);
      curl_close($ch);
      return $response;
   }


   public static function strip_whitespace($data) {
      $data = preg_replace('/\s+/', ' ', $data);
      return trim($data);
   }


   public static function extract_elements($tag, $data) {
      $response = array();
      $dom      = new DOMDocument;
      @$dom-&gt;loadHTML($data);
      foreach ( $dom-&gt;getElementsByTagName($tag) as $index =&gt; $element ) {
         $response[$index]['text'] = self::strip_whitespace($element-&gt;nodeValue);
         foreach ( $element-&gt;attributes as $attribute ) {
            $response[$index]['attributes'][strtolower($attribute-&gt;nodeName)] = self::strip_whitespace($attribute-&gt;nodeValue);
         }
      }
      return $response;
   }


}
</code></pre>

<hr>

<p><strong>example usage:</strong></p>

<pre><code>$data  = crawler::http_request('https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2313107/how-do-i-make-a-simple-crawler-in-php');
$links = crawler::extract_elements('a', $data);
if ( count($links) &gt; 0 ) {
   file_put_contents('links.json', json_encode($links, JSON_PRETTY_PRINT));
}
</code></pre>

<hr>

<p><strong>example response:</strong></p>

<pre><code>[
    {
        "text": "Stack Overflow",
        "attributes": {
            "href": "https:\/\/stackoverflow.com",
            "class": "-logo js-gps-track",
            "data-gps-track": "top_nav.click({is_current:false, location:2, destination:8})"
        }
    },
    {
        "text": "Questions",
        "attributes": {
            "id": "nav-questions",
            "href": "\/questions",
            "class": "-link js-gps-track",
            "data-gps-track": "top_nav.click({is_current:true, location:2, destination:1})"
        }
    },
    {
        "text": "Developer Jobs",
        "attributes": {
            "id": "nav-jobs",
            "href": "\/jobs?med=site-ui&amp;ref=jobs-tab",
            "class": "-link js-gps-track",
            "data-gps-track": "top_nav.click({is_current:false, location:2, destination:6})"
        }
    }
]
</code></pre>
    </div>

<a name="54029578"></a>
<div id="answer-54029578" class="answer" data-answerid="54029578"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="54029578">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="0">0</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>It's an old question. A lot of good things happened since then. Here are my two cents on this topic:</p>

<ol>
<li><p>To accurately track the visited pages you have to normalize URI first. The normalization algorithm includes multiple steps:</p>

<ul>
<li>Sort query parameters. For example, the following URIs are equivalent after normalization:
<code>
GET http://www.example.com/query?id=111&amp;cat=222
GET http://www.example.com/query?cat=222&amp;id=111
</code></li>
<li><p>Convert the empty path.
Example: <code>http://example.org → http://example.org/</code></p></li>
<li><p>Capitalize percent encoding. All letters within a percent-encoding triplet (e.g., "%3A") are case-insensitive.
Example: <code>http://example.org/a%c2%B1b → http://example.org/a%C2%B1b</code></p></li>
<li><p>Remove unnecessary dot-segments.
Example: <code>http://example.org/../a/b/../c/./d.html → http://example.org/a/c/d.html</code></p></li>
<li><p>Possibly some other normalization rules</p></li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Not only <code>&lt;a&gt;</code> tag has <code>href</code> attribute, <code>&lt;area&gt;</code> tag has it too <a href="https://html.com/tags/area/" rel="nofollow noreferrer">https://html.com/tags/area/</a>. If you don't want to miss anything, you have to scrape <code>&lt;area&gt;</code> tag too.</p></li>
<li><p>Track crawling progress. If the website is small, it is not a problem. Contrarily it might be very frustrating if you crawl half of the site and it failed. Consider using a database or a filesystem to store the progress.</p></li>
<li><p>Be kind to the site owners.
If you are ever going to use your crawler outside of your website, you have to use delays. Without delays, the script is too fast and might significantly slow down some small sites. From sysadmins perspective, it looks like a DoS attack. A static delay between the requests will do the trick.</p></li>
</ol>

<p>If you don't want to deal with that, try <a href="https://github.com/crawlzone/crawlzone" rel="nofollow noreferrer">Crawlzone</a> and let me know your feedback. Also, check out the article I wrote a while back <a href="https://www.codementor.io/zstate/this-is-how-i-crawl-n98s6myxm" rel="nofollow noreferrer">https://www.codementor.io/zstate/this-is-how-i-crawl-n98s6myxm</a></p>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2019-01-03T20:47:49"></time>
    <div class="grid--cell mr16" style="flex: 1 1 100px;">

            <script>
            StackExchange.ifUsing("editor", function () {
                StackExchange.using("externalEditor", function () {
                    StackExchange.using("snippets", function () {
                        StackExchange.snippets.init();
                    });
                });
            }, "code-snippets");

<script>
    StackExchange.ready(function() {
        var channelOptions = {
            tags: "".split(" "),
            id: "1"
        };
        initTagRenderer("".split(" "), "".split(" "), channelOptions);
       
        StackExchange.using("externalEditor", function() {
                // Have to fire editor after snippets, if snippets enabled
                if (StackExchange.settings.snippets.snippetsEnabled) {
                    StackExchange.using("snippets", function() {
                        createEditor();
                    });
                }
                else {
                    createEditor();
                }
            });

            function createEditor() {
                StackExchange.prepareEditor({
                    heartbeatType: 'answer',
                    autoActivateHeartbeat: false,
                    convertImagesToLinks: true,
                noModals: true,
                showLowRepImageUploadWarning: true,
                reputationToPostImages: 10,
                bindNavPrevention: true,
                postfix: "",
                imageUploader: {
                    brandingHtml: "Powered by \u003ca class=\"icon-imgur-white\" href=\"https://imgur.com/\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e",
                    contentPolicyHtml: "User contributions licensed under \u003ca href=\"https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/\"\u003ecc by-sa 3.0 with attribution required\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://stackoverflow.com/legal/content-policy\"\u003e(content policy)\u003c/a\u003e",
                    allowUrls: true
                },
                    onDemand: true,
                    discardSelector: ".discard-answer"
                    ,immediatelyShowMarkdownHelp:true
                    });
                

        }
    });
</script>

            </div>
            <script>
                StackExchange.ready(
                    function () {
                        StackExchange.openid.initPostLogin('.new-post-login', 'https%3a%2f%2fstackoverflow.com%2fquestions%2f2313107%2fhow-do-i-make-a-simple-crawler-in-php%23new-answer', 'question_page');
                    }
                );
            </script>

    <link itemprop="image" href="https://cdn.sstatic.net/Sites/stackoverflow/img/apple-touch-icon.png?v=c78bd457575a">

    <div class="inner-content clearfix">
    
    

<style>.everyoneloves__top-leaderboard:empty,.everyoneloves__mid-leaderboard:empty,.everyoneloves__bot-mid-leaderboard:empty{                height:90px;width:728px;box-sizing:border-box;

        <div id="dfp-tlb" class="everyonelovesstackoverflow everyoneloves__top-leaderboard"></div>            <div id="question-header" class="grid">
                    <h1 itemprop="name" class="grid--cell fs-headline1 fl1 ow-break-word"><a href="/questions/2313107/how-do-i-make-a-simple-crawler-in-php" class="question-hyperlink">How do I make a simple crawler in PHP?</a></h1>

            
<div class="pl8 aside-cta grid--cell" role="navigation" aria-label="ask new question">
        <a href="/questions/ask" class="d-inline-flex ai-center ws-nowrap s-btn s-btn__primary" >
            Ask Question
        </a>
</div>

        </div>
            <div id="mainbar" role="main" aria-label="question and answers">

            

<div class="question" data-questionid="2313107"  id="question">

    
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="2313107">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This question shows research effort; it is useful and clear" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="62">62</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This question does not show any research effort; it is unclear or not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>

        <button class="js-favorite-btn s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer py8" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="favorite (77)" data-selected-classes="fc-yellow-600">
            <svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconStar" width="18" height="18" viewBox="0 0 18 18"><path d="M9 12.65l-5.29 3.63 1.82-6.15L.44 6.22l6.42-.17L9 0l2.14 6.05 6.42.17-5.1 3.9 1.83 6.16z"/></svg>
            <div class="js-favorite-count mt8" data-value="77">77</div>
        </button>


</div>

            </div>

            
<div class="postcell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">

<p>I have a web page with a bunch of links. I want to write a script which would dump all the data contained in those links in a local file.</p>

<p>Has anybody done that with PHP? General guidelines and gotchas would suffice as an answer.</p>
    </div>

        <div class="post-taglist grid gs4 gsy fd-column">
            <div class="grid ps-relative d-block">
                <a href="/questions/tagged/php" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged &#39;php&#39;" rel="tag">php</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/web-crawler" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged &#39;web-crawler&#39;" rel="tag">web-crawler</a> 
            </div>
        </div>

        <div class="mt16 pt4 grid gs8 gsy fw-wrap jc-end ai-start">

<div id="answer-2313270" class="answer accepted-answer" data-answerid="2313270"  itemprop="acceptedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="2313270">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="87">87</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>Meh. Don't <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1732348/regex-match-open-tags-except-xhtml-self-contained-tags">parse HTML with regexes</a>.</p>

<p>Here's a DOM version inspired by Tatu's:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?php
function crawl_page($url, $depth = 5)
{
    static $seen = array();
    if (isset($seen[$url]) || $depth === 0) {
        return;
    }

    $seen[$url] = true;

    $dom = new DOMDocument('1.0');
    @$dom-&gt;loadHTMLFile($url);

    $anchors = $dom-&gt;getElementsByTagName('a');
    foreach ($anchors as $element) {
        $href = $element-&gt;getAttribute('href');
        if (0 !== strpos($href, 'http')) {
            $path = '/' . ltrim($href, '/');
            if (extension_loaded('http')) {
                $href = http_build_url($url, array('path' =&gt; $path));
            } else {
                $parts = parse_url($url);
                $href = $parts['scheme'] . '://';
                if (isset($parts['user']) &amp;&amp; isset($parts['pass'])) {
                    $href .= $parts['user'] . ':' . $parts['pass'] . '@';
                }
                $href .= $parts['host'];
                if (isset($parts['port'])) {
                    $href .= ':' . $parts['port'];
                }
                $href .= dirname($parts['path'], 1).$path;
            }
        }
        crawl_page($href, $depth - 1);
    }
    echo "URL:",$url,PHP_EOL,"CONTENT:",PHP_EOL,$dom-&gt;saveHTML(),PHP_EOL,PHP_EOL;
}
crawl_page("http://hobodave.com", 2);
</code></pre>

<p><strong>Edit:</strong> I fixed some bugs from Tatu's version (works with relative URLs now).</p>

<p><strong>Edit:</strong> I added a new bit of functionality that prevents it from following the same URL twice.</p>

<p><strong>Edit:</strong> echoing output to STDOUT now so you can redirect it to whatever file you want</p>

<p><strong>Edit:</strong> Fixed a bug pointed out by George in his answer. Relative urls will no longer append to the end of the url path, but overwrite it. Thanks to George for this. Note that George's answer doesn't account for any of: https, user, pass, or port. If you have the <a href="http://us3.php.net/manual/en/book.http.php" rel="noreferrer">http</a> PECL extension loaded this is quite simply done using <a href="http://us3.php.net/manual/en/function.http-build-url.php" rel="noreferrer">http_build_url</a>. Otherwise, I have to manually glue together using parse_url. Thanks again George.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2010-02-22T18:47:18"></time>

<a name="24041887"></a>
<div id="answer-24041887" class="answer" data-answerid="24041887"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="24041887">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="15">15</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>Here my implementation based on the above example/answer.</p>

<ol>
<li>It is class based </li>
<li>uses Curl</li>
<li>support HTTP Auth</li>
<li>Skip Url not belonging to the base domain</li>
<li>Return Http header Response Code for each page</li>
<li>Return time for each page</li>
</ol>

<p>CRAWL CLASS:</p>

<pre><code>class crawler
{
    protected $_url;
    protected $_depth;
    protected $_host;
    protected $_useHttpAuth = false;
    protected $_user;
    protected $_pass;
    protected $_seen = array();
    protected $_filter = array();

    public function __construct($url, $depth = 5)
    {
        $this-&gt;_url = $url;
        $this-&gt;_depth = $depth;
        $parse = parse_url($url);
        $this-&gt;_host = $parse['host'];
    }

    protected function _processAnchors($content, $url, $depth)
    {
        $dom = new DOMDocument('1.0');
        @$dom-&gt;loadHTML($content);
        $anchors = $dom-&gt;getElementsByTagName('a');

        foreach ($anchors as $element) {
            $href = $element-&gt;getAttribute('href');
            if (0 !== strpos($href, 'http')) {
                $path = '/' . ltrim($href, '/');
                if (extension_loaded('http')) {
                    $href = http_build_url($url, array('path' =&gt; $path));
                } else {
                    $parts = parse_url($url);
                    $href = $parts['scheme'] . '://';
                    if (isset($parts['user']) &amp;&amp; isset($parts['pass'])) {
                        $href .= $parts['user'] . ':' . $parts['pass'] . '@';
                    }
                    $href .= $parts['host'];
                    if (isset($parts['port'])) {
                        $href .= ':' . $parts['port'];
                    }
                    $href .= $path;
                }
            }
            // Crawl only link that belongs to the start domain
            $this-&gt;crawl_page($href, $depth - 1);
        }
    }

    protected function _getContent($url)
    {
        $handle = curl_init($url);
        if ($this-&gt;_useHttpAuth) {
            curl_setopt($handle, CURLOPT_HTTPAUTH, CURLAUTH_ANY);
            curl_setopt($handle, CURLOPT_USERPWD, $this-&gt;_user . ":" . $this-&gt;_pass);
        }
        // follows 302 redirect, creates problem wiht authentication
//        curl_setopt($handle, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, TRUE);
        // return the content
        curl_setopt($handle, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, TRUE);

        /* Get the HTML or whatever is linked in $url. */
        $response = curl_exec($handle);
        // response total time
        $time = curl_getinfo($handle, CURLINFO_TOTAL_TIME);
        /* Check for 404 (file not found). */
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($handle, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);

        curl_close($handle);
        return array($response, $httpCode, $time);
    }

    protected function _printResult($url, $depth, $httpcode, $time)
    {
        ob_end_flush();
        $currentDepth = $this-&gt;_depth - $depth;
        $count = count($this-&gt;_seen);
        echo "N::$count,CODE::$httpcode,TIME::$time,DEPTH::$currentDepth URL::$url &lt;br&gt;";
        ob_start();
        flush();
    }

    protected function isValid($url, $depth)
    {
        if (strpos($url, $this-&gt;_host) === false
            || $depth === 0
            || isset($this-&gt;_seen[$url])
        ) {
            return false;
        }
        foreach ($this-&gt;_filter as $excludePath) {
            if (strpos($url, $excludePath) !== false) {
                return false;
            }
        }
        return true;
    }

    public function crawl_page($url, $depth)
    {
        if (!$this-&gt;isValid($url, $depth)) {
            return;
        }
        // add to the seen URL
        $this-&gt;_seen[$url] = true;
        // get Content and Return Code
        list($content, $httpcode, $time) = $this-&gt;_getContent($url);
        // print Result for current Page
        $this-&gt;_printResult($url, $depth, $httpcode, $time);
        // process subPages
        $this-&gt;_processAnchors($content, $url, $depth);
    }

    public function setHttpAuth($user, $pass)
    {
        $this-&gt;_useHttpAuth = true;
        $this-&gt;_user = $user;
        $this-&gt;_pass = $pass;
    }

    public function addFilterPath($path)
    {
        $this-&gt;_filter[] = $path;
    }

    public function run()
    {
        $this-&gt;crawl_page($this-&gt;_url, $this-&gt;_depth);
    }
}
</code></pre>

<p>USAGE:</p>

<pre><code>// USAGE
$startURL = 'http://YOUR_URL/';
$depth = 6;
$username = 'YOURUSER';
$password = 'YOURPASS';
$crawler = new crawler($startURL, $depth);
$crawler-&gt;setHttpAuth($username, $password);
// Exclude path with the following structure to be processed 
$crawler-&gt;addFilterPath('customer/account/login/referer');
$crawler-&gt;run();
</code></pre>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2014-06-04T15:44:14"></time>

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="2313133">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>

                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>Check out PHP Crawler</p>

<p><a href="http://sourceforge.net/projects/php-crawler/" rel="noreferrer">http://sourceforge.net/projects/php-crawler/</a></p>

<p>See if it helps.</p>

    <li id="comment-84696440" class="comment js-comment " data-comment-id="84696440">
        <div class="js-comment-actions comment-actions">

<a name="2313146"></a>
<div id="answer-2313146" class="answer" data-answerid="2313146"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="2313146">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="9">9</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>In it's simplest form:</p>

<pre><code>function crawl_page($url, $depth = 5) {
    if($depth &gt; 0) {
        $html = file_get_contents($url);

        preg_match_all('~&lt;a.*?href="(.*?)".*?&gt;~', $html, $matches);

        foreach($matches[1] as $newurl) {
            crawl_page($newurl, $depth - 1);
        }

        file_put_contents('results.txt', $newurl."\n\n".$html."\n\n", FILE_APPEND);
    }
}

crawl_page('http://www.domain.com/index.php', 5);
</code></pre>

<p>That function will get contents from a page, then crawl all found links and save the contents to 'results.txt'. The functions accepts an second parameter, depth, which defines how long the links should be followed. Pass 1 there if you want to parse only links from the given page.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2010-02-22T18:29:07"></time>
    <div class="grid--cell mr16" style="flex: 1 1 100px;">

<a name="12193232"></a>
<div id="answer-12193232" class="answer" data-answerid="12193232"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="12193232">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="5">5</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>With some little changes to <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/users/105662/hobodave">hobodave's</a> code, here is a codesnippet you can use to crawl pages. This needs the curl extension to be enabled in your server.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?php
//set_time_limit (0);
function crawl_page($url, $depth = 5){
$seen = array();
if(($depth == 0) or (in_array($url, $seen))){
    return;
}   
$ch = curl_init();
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER,1);
$result = curl_exec ($ch);
curl_close ($ch);
if( $result ){
    $stripped_file = strip_tags($result, "&lt;a&gt;");
    preg_match_all("/&lt;a[\s]+[^&gt;]*?href[\s]?=[\s\"\']+"."(.*?)[\"\']+.*?&gt;"."([^&lt;]+|.*?)?&lt;\/a&gt;/", $stripped_file, $matches, PREG_SET_ORDER ); 
    foreach($matches as $match){
        $href = $match[1];
            if (0 !== strpos($href, 'http')) {
                $path = '/' . ltrim($href, '/');
                if (extension_loaded('http')) {
                    $href = http_build_url($href , array('path' =&gt; $path));
                } else {
                    $parts = parse_url($href);
                    $href = $parts['scheme'] . '://';
                    if (isset($parts['user']) &amp;&amp; isset($parts['pass'])) {
                        $href .= $parts['user'] . ':' . $parts['pass'] . '@';
                    }
                    $href .= $parts['host'];
                    if (isset($parts['port'])) {
                        $href .= ':' . $parts['port'];
                    }
                    $href .= $path;
                }
            }
            crawl_page($href, $depth - 1);
        }
}   
echo "Crawled {$href}";
}   
crawl_page("http://www.sitename.com/",3);
?&gt;
</code></pre>

<p>I have explained this tutorial in this <a href="http://www.webgalli.com/blog/?p=1253" rel="nofollow noreferrer">crawler script tutorial</a></p>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2012-08-30T08:53:19"></time>

<a name="2313172"></a>
<div id="answer-2313172" class="answer" data-answerid="2313172"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="2313172">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="4">4</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>Why use PHP for this, when you can use <a href="http://www.rootr.net/man/info/wget" rel="nofollow noreferrer">wget</a>, e.g.</p>

<pre><code>wget -r -l 1 http://www.example.com
</code></pre>

<p>For how to parse the contents, see <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3577641/best-methods-to-parse-html/3577662#3577662">Best Methods to parse HTML</a> and use the search function for <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3820666/grabbing-the-href-attribute-of-an-a-element/3820783#3820783">examples</a>. How to parse HTML has been answered multiple times before.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2010-02-22T18:33:07"></time>
    <div class="grid--cell mr16" style="flex: 1 1 100px;">

    <div class="post-signature grid--cell fl0">

    <li id="comment-2280641" class="comment js-comment " data-comment-id="2280641">
        <div class="js-comment-actions comment-actions">
            <div class="comment-score">

        <div class="comment-text js-comment-text-and-form">
            <div class="comment-body" style="display: block;" >
                
                <span class="comment-copy">Some specific fields have to be parsed and taken out. I will need to write code.</span>
                
                    &ndash;&nbsp;<a href="/users/140970/kshitij-saxena-kj"
                       title="10,362 reputation"
                       class="comment-user owner">Kshitij Saxena -KJ-</a>
                <span class="comment-date" dir="ltr"><span title="2010-02-22 18:35:18Z" class="relativetime-clean">Feb 22 '10 at 18:35</span></span>

    </li>
    <li id="comment-2280670" class="comment js-comment " data-comment-id="2280670">
        <div class="js-comment-actions comment-actions">
            <div class="comment-score">
            </div>
                    </div>
        <div class="comment-text js-comment-text-and-form">
            <div class="comment-body" style="display: block;" >
                
                <span class="comment-copy">@Crimson that&#39;s a requirement you should note in the question then ;)</span>
                
                    &ndash;&nbsp;<a href="/users/208809/gordon"
                       title="264,211 reputation"
                       class="comment-user">Gordon</a>

<a name="5877026"></a>
<div id="answer-5877026" class="answer" data-answerid="5877026"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="5877026">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="3">3</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>Hobodave you were very close. The only thing I have changed is within the if statement that checks to see if the href attribute of the found anchor tag begins with 'http'. Instead of simply adding the $url variable which would contain the page that was passed in you must first strip it down to the host which can be done using the parse_url php function.</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?php
function crawl_page($url, $depth = 5)
{
  static $seen = array();
  if (isset($seen[$url]) || $depth === 0) {
    return;
  }

  $seen[$url] = true;

  $dom = new DOMDocument('1.0');
  @$dom-&gt;loadHTMLFile($url);

  $anchors = $dom-&gt;getElementsByTagName('a');
  foreach ($anchors as $element) {
    $href = $element-&gt;getAttribute('href');
    if (0 !== strpos($href, 'http')) {
       /* this is where I changed hobodave's code */
        $host = "http://".parse_url($url,PHP_URL_HOST);
        $href = $host. '/' . ltrim($href, '/');
    }
    crawl_page($href, $depth - 1);
  }

  echo "New Page:&lt;br /&gt; ";
  echo "URL:",$url,PHP_EOL,"&lt;br /&gt;","CONTENT:",PHP_EOL,$dom-&gt;saveHTML(),PHP_EOL,PHP_EOL,"  &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;";
}

crawl_page("http://hobodave.com/", 5);
?&gt;
</code></pre>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2011-05-03T23:50:47"></time>

<div id="answer-2313212" class="answer" data-answerid="2313212"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="2313212">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>As mentioned, there are crawler frameworks all ready for customizing out there, but if what you're doing is as simple as you mentioned, you could make it from scratch pretty easily.</p>

<p>Scraping the links: <a href="http://www.phpro.org/examples/Get-Links-With-DOM.html" rel="nofollow noreferrer">http://www.phpro.org/examples/Get-Links-With-DOM.html</a></p>

<p>Dumping results to a file: <a href="http://www.tizag.com/phpT/filewrite.php" rel="nofollow noreferrer">http://www.tizag.com/phpT/filewrite.php</a></p>
    </div>

    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>The question is how to get ajax calls source code? this is not crawled, for example how to crawl the pictures on a link like this? <a href="http://www.tiendeo.nl/Catalogi/amsterdam/16558&amp;subori=web_sliders&amp;buscar=Boni&amp;sw=1366" rel="nofollow">http://www.tiendeo.nl/Catalogi/amsterdam/16558&amp;subori=web_sliders&amp;buscar=Boni&amp;sw=1366</a></p>

<a name="32604778"></a>
<div id="answer-32604778" class="answer" data-answerid="32604778"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="32604778">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="1">1</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>

</div>

            </div>
            

<div class="answercell post-layout--right">
    
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="text">
<p>I used @hobodave's code, with this little tweak to prevent re-crawling all fragment variants of the same URL:</p>

<pre><code>&lt;?php
function crawl_page($url, $depth = 5)
{
  $parts = parse_url($url);
  if(array_key_exists('fragment', $parts)){
    unset($parts['fragment']);
    $url = http_build_url($parts);
  }

  static $seen = array();
  ...
</code></pre>

<p>Then you can also omit the <code>$parts = parse_url($url);</code> line within the for loop.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="grid mb0 fw-wrap ai-start jc-end gs8 gsy">
        <time itemprop="dateCreated" datetime="2015-09-16T09:32:37"></time>

<a name="35146732"></a>
<div id="answer-35146732" class="answer" data-answerid="35146732"  itemprop="suggestedAnswer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Answer">
    <div class="post-layout">
            <div class="votecell post-layout--left">
                

<div class="js-voting-container grid fd-column ai-stretch gs4 fc-black-200" data-post-id="35146732">
        <button class="js-vote-up-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="up vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowUpLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 26h32L18 10z"/></svg></button>
        <div class="js-vote-count grid--cell fc-black-500 fs-title grid fd-column ai-center" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-value="1">1</div>
        <button class="js-vote-down-btn grid--cell s-btn s-btn__unset c-pointer" title="This answer is not useful" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="down vote" data-selected-classes="fc-theme-primary"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon m0 iconArrowDownLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M2 10h32L18 26z"/></svg></button>


                <div class="js-accepted-answer-indicator grid--item fc-green-500 ta-center p4 d-none" title="loading when this answer was accepted..." tabindex="0" role="note" aria-label="accepted"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-icon iconCheckmarkLg" width="36" height="36" viewBox="0 0 36 36"><path d="M6 14l8 8L30 6v8L14 30l-8-8z"/></svg></div>
